column4: look i can't run apt-get because everytime i try it prints "You might want to run `apt-get -f install' to correct these:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:"
did you try running sudo apt-get -f install then?
but i dont want to install those packages
well you need to fix the errors first
what errors?
it says its going to install the linux-image-2.6.12-9-k7 but my current version is 2.6.12-10-386
I dunno you have some broken dependency somewhere I'm sure there is  away to ignore the error though but I wouldn't.
so you suggest that i run the apt-get -f install afterall?
what are you ultimately trying to do?  Just install something?
yup
and the problem is you can't because of that message?
what are you trying to install that it wants to do that?
right
what package are you trying to install?
i tried to install cl-jpeg earlier
is there someway to sortof regret it? :P
okay well what I would do is backup my /boot/grub/menu.1st then do the -f install that way you still remember the old kernel name.
regardless of what it wants to install it should still boot to the newest kernel.
yeah you're right, feels kinda risky though
not really it should still boot the newer kernel and it will make apt happy so you can use it again.  Or you can remove the package that is giving your grief if you don't need it.
